Posts.Content: Nov 3, 2008 11:29AM LiveLoveBelieve wrote:  Thank you so very much, everyone who responded.  Believe it or not I work for the Federal govt. - we have quite a bit of protection - but expectations are another thing.  I do feel better, I do; just knowing that I am not crazy thinking that I should be all dressed and ready to go! Thanks again; I so appreciate this Board.  This is my first day posting and I have been going a bit crazy w/ questions - but I hope to "give back" to others, once things have calmed down. Enjoy the day, llb
Posts.Title: Mastectomy last week - expected to return to work! LiveLoveBelieve Rovergirl

Posts.Content: Nov 19, 2008 11:52PM LiveLoveBelieve wrote: KatieJane - Thank you for your quick reply.  I am sorry to hear that you are going through this. I have a friend who developed LE in her leg, requiring daily attention. My PT seems to not want to scare me - as I had expressed my concerns fairly strongly.  That being said, she has asked a LE specialist to meet with me tomorrow. So I am pleased that she is so proactive (confirming what you said). Thanks again for your response (and support!)  Your LE sounds like it started in your arm;  mine is in my chest and back.  I wonder if mine will then move to my arm.  Remains to be seen.  I need to stop worrying!  It is not a negative path. result, eh?  LiveLoveBelieve
